main event: Several witnesses observed a bright object resembling a ball of fire traveling through the sky over St. Louis, Missouri, on May 19, 1949.
interesting points: The object was seen trailing flames and appeared to disintegrate during the observation., Witnesses included military personnel flying at various altitudes., Observers described the object as moving in a horizontal direction, unlike typical meteor trajectories., One witness noted the absence of running lights on the object, suggesting it might not have been an aircraft., The sighting lasted for about 5 seconds or less, and the object disappeared suddenly without any increase or decrease in light intensity.
sighted object: ball of fire with a trail of sparks
witness description: The observers were military personnel, including pilots and a lieutenant commander.
